Cursed Touch.name: Cursed Touch
Cursed Touch.blurb: Amumu's basic attacks Curse enemies for 3 seconds, causing them to take 10% bonus true damage from any magic damage dealt to them.
Cursed Touch.description: Innate: Amumu's basic attacks and  Curse of the Sad Mummy apply a Curse for 3 seconds, refreshing with each subsequent basic attack.
Cursed Touch.description2: Cursed targets receive  10% bonus true damage from all incoming pre-mitigation magic damage.
Cursed Touch.notes:
* If Amumu has on-hit magic damage, the Curse will be applied before the magic damage.
 Neutral units / enemies affected by the Curse can receive bonus damage from the opposing team of Amumu / neutral units, but the damage will be credited to Amumu.

Bandage Toss.name: Bandage Toss
Bandage Toss.blurb: Amumu tosses a sticky bandage at a target, stunning and damaging the target while he pulls himself to them.
Bandage Toss.description: Active: Amumu tosses a bandage in the target direction that  stuns the first enemy it hits for 1 second, dealing  magic damage and  pulling him to their location.
Bandage Toss.notes:
* Bandage Toss will always be directed towards the target location even if Amumu moves during it.
 Bandage Toss follows his target for up to 2000 units from where he cast Bandage Toss, in case targets get out of the stun before he arrives.
 Bandage Toss cannot be cast while Amumu is  rooted.
 Crowd control effects will not prevent Amumu from commencing the dash. However, the duration of the crowd control can persist the duration of the dash.
 While Amumu is mid-dash, only  airborne crowd control effects will prevent him from reaching his target. Other forms of crowd control will still be applied, but they will not hinder his movement.
 Bandage Toss does not fizzle on Amumu's death, and can still stun and damage enemies.
 Amumu is still able to dash even if Bandage Toss is blocked by  spell shield.
 Amumu will attempt to basic attack the target. If Bandage Toss is used beyond Amumu's basic attack range, this basic attack will not grant any stack of  Conqueror,  Electrocute,  Phase Rush or  Spellthief's Edge.

Despair.name: Despair
Despair.blurb: Overcome by anguish, nearby enemies lose a percentage of their maximum Health each second and have their Curses refreshed.
Despair.description: Toggle: Amumu cries a continuous pool of tears, refreshing Curse for 3 seconds and dealing magic damage every half second to nearby enemies.
Despair.leveling:
Magic Damage Per Half Second:
5 / 7.5 / 10 / 12.5 / 15 (+ 0.5 / 0.625 / 0.75 / 0.875 / 1% (+ 0.5% per 100 AP) of target's maximum health)
Despair.notes:
* Despair has a minimum duration of 1 second.
 Despite the rounding in Despair's tooltip, it will deal increased damage for every point of ability power.
 Despair cannot be toggled-off while under  silencing effects.
 Toggled abilities do not count as ability activation for the purposes of effects such as Spellblade or  Force Pulse.

Tantrum.name: Tantrum
Tantrum.blurb: Permanently reduces the physical damage Amumu would take. Amumu can unleash his rage, dealing damage to surrounding enemies. Each time Amumu is hit, the cooldown on Tantrum is reduced by 0.5 seconds.
Tantrum.description: Passive: Amumu takes reduced post-mitigation damage from each tick of physical damage.
Tantrum.leveling:
Physical Damage Reduction:
2 / 4 / 6 / 8 / 10 (+ 3% bonus armor) (+ 3% bonus magic resistance)
Tantrum.description2: Active: Amumu releases his anger, dealing magic damage to nearby enemies.
Tantrum.description3: Tantrum's  cooldown is reduced by 0.5 seconds every time Amumu is hit by a basic attack.
Tantrum.notes:
*  Turret attacks count as basic attacks.
 Tantrum's cooldown reduction will trigger multiple times for effects such as  Double Strike.

Curse of the Sad Mummy.name: Curse of the Sad Mummy
Curse of the Sad Mummy.blurb: Amumu entangles surrounding enemy units in bandages, applying his Curse, damaging them and rendering them unable to attack or move.
Curse of the Sad Mummy.description: Active: Amumu  entangles nearby enemies for 2 seconds, dealing magic damage.
